intro: Medinilla muricata, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are thick, leathery, and have a deep green color, while its flowers are usually pink or red with a distinctive waxy texture. Medinilla muricata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in humid environments.
